One of the greatest things about men's fall fashion developments for 2011 is quite possibly sophisticated without lacking curiosity and fun. Menswear is creating a move away from vibrant and flamboyant looks, and trending towards fashions which can be mature and refined, nevertheless appropriate for any market. Here are the staples for a fall 2011 wardrobe.

Sweatshirts:
<br> Sweaters, particularly zip front or button top cardigans, are great for fall of 2011. They can even serve as an alternative for a jacket on the chilly day. Look for sweaters that are constructed of wool, cotton, or chenille. Stay away from acrylics, as these can be difficult to care with regard to, don't breath well, and tend to pill quickly. A great look for fall is a Nordic create. Insure that the sweater contains a nice, snug fit and fails to hang down in this armpits.

Tweed:
<br> Perhaps you believe of your seventh grade science teacher after you think of tweed. But tweed is huge for fall and may be incorporated into your outfit to get a modern look. It is exhilarating for the "dressy casual" look that has become popular this year. Try layering a tweed sport jacket over a pair of dark denim jeans and then a button down shirt. Or, to wear tweed more subtly, try it within a Ivy or Newsboy cap.

Textured Scarves:
<br> A cool new trend for fall of 2011 is a trend of textured scarves. Texture in a tie can be a bit unexpected, so it automatically develops interest and luxury for a outfit. You will however need to consider quality as this year depends upon chicness.

" booties ":
<br> Men's boots are huge for fall of 2011. This is a decidedly more industrial look compared to a loafer or an oxford. But there are brands and styles of boots available that are just as comfortable as their lighter footwear counterparts. Soft leather ankle boots, with their flexible material and limited design, are very comfortable and versatile. Look for lace up ones using a rounded toe in darkish or reddish brown. If you happen to prefer black boots, aquire a slightly taller boot using military or motorcycle inspired accents which include side buckles.

Colors Trend- Mixed Gray Shades:
<br> Gray may seem like sort of muted color, but as soon as you mix it in several tones, it creates a very sophisticated monochromatic look. Shop for gray three piece accommodates, fine knit sweaters, man made fiber ties, overcoats, and jeans. Then, mix and coordinate these pieces. Avoid wearing all one shade with gray, and instead assemble your outfit in shades ranging from light gray to grilling with charcoal.

The "Geek Chic" Look:
<br> You've probably noticed celebrities going up at events sporting deep rimmed glasses and bowties of late. First made popular as a result of Indie rockers, this is a versatile and great try to look for fall known as "geek chic. " To pull that off, essentials in ones wardrobe are bow ties, sweater vests, wide rimmed sunglasses, and a splash associated with argyle. The biggest rule of the geek chic look is that it has to look polished. So if you use a silk screened first tee shirt, make sure to layer it over a button down shirt in a bright or pastel shade.
